intro: Cleyera conocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Cleyera conocarpa typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of its native ecosystem.
